fields.description:
The square brackets cause the svn permissions manager to think a new section has been encountered, which causes a lot of extraneous, non-existent directories to be listed in the svn authz file and shown in the UI (and possibly thrown at FE/Cru, but I haven't verified that).

I'm not sure what happens with spaces, but anecdotal evidence suggests group names with spaces may play havok also.

Known possible solutions are:
1) Fix repoman to work with these
2) Prevent non alphaNumericHyphenUnderscore groups from being created, upgrade the names of existing such groups, and  remove any such lines from the svn repository authz file.

The only known workaround at the moment is to avoid using groups with square brackets in their names.
fields.summary: Square brackets and possibly spaces in groups names break svn permissions management

We'll likely need to wait till the individual apps support Firefox 4 first:

[Crucible|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-5698]
[JIRA|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24169]
[Bamboo|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-8357]

[FishEye|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-2996]
[Confluence|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-22057]

Since the upgrade to 2.4.1, two functions from search are not working properly.  When typing in a search word, if one clicks on the dynamic drop down list of choices that appear, it no longer takes one to the desired page. It remains on the current page. This would happen some of the time previously, but it now happens all of the time. 

As a work around to the above, one used to be able to down arrow into the list, hit [enter], and go to the selected page.  The down arrow button no longer moves focus to the list.
fields.summary: Live Search Buggy with Internet Explorer 8

fields.summary: JIRA Attach Screenshot doesn't work for Google Users

fields.description:
When viewing the Planning Board for a release, Issues that are marked as "Closed" still appear even when either or both of the filters "Only Pending Issues" and "Hide Done Issues" are applied (see screenshot).

In the summary tile, a large number of Issues are reported as "In-Progress", despite the fact that most Issues are "Closed". Is it possible that this is related to the Tempo plugin in some way and that Issues with remaining estimated time are not considered "Done"?

When an Issue is marked "Closed", it should be closed independent of whether there is remaining estimated time. This bug makes it *very* difficult to assess remaining work on a sprint or project
fields.summary: "Closed" Issues still showing as "Pending" in Agile Planning Board

fields.description:
FishEye currently does not include the PostgreSQL JDBC driver but it is needed as part of AOD-2594.

Currently the HSQL-to-Postgres migration script will check to see if a {{postgres-\*jdbc\*.jar}} exists in {{/opt/j2ee/domains/jirastudio.com/instance/fisheye/fisheye/lib}}. If not, it will symlink {{/opt/java/jars/jdbc/postgresql-jdbc4.jar}} into there. The other apps use the same symlink but inside their Tomcat common lib dir.

I'm not sure if this is handled at the fireball level or the deployment level, but we need to ensure that FishEye continues to have access to a Postgres driver in future releases.
fields.summary: Please include the PostgreSQL JDBC driver with FishEye

fields.summary: After upgrading to JIRA 4.3, the Embedded Crowd upgrade task could throw NPE in XML restore in functional tests

fields.description:
Administration->Issues->System->Atlassian Support Tools->Support Request

Attempting to send a Support Request using this form fails with "Error retrieving results: undefined". Nothing appears in the JIRA logs.

Works fine in JIRA 4.3 standalone.

!SupportRequest.png!
fields.summary: Sending a Support Request from the JIRA 4.3 Support Tools plugin fails

fields.description:
If I logged in as a common admin user (as opposed to the sysadmin) then clicked the link for the "Remember My Login" admin page, I will get a page saying "You cannot view this page as a guest" and asking me for credentials. It turned out that I need to provide the credentials for sysadmin to get through that login page. Then a question is raised that whether we should include the "Remember My Login" feature in the first place if it has to be used as sysadmin, since other sysadmin-only features are not visible to the common admin user. Or on the other hand, if we do want to expose this feature then maybe we don't want to ask for the sysadmin credentials for it.
!remember-my-login.png!
fields.summary: "Remember My Login" admin page asks for sysadmin credentials

fields.description:
Notification messages and dialogs in JIRA (I think anything that uses a z-index) are appearing underneath the Studio Header in IE7.

e.g. 1) Notification messages that are shown after you modify an issue from the issue nav:
!IE7Notification.png!

e.g. 2) Issue transition dialogs from both Issue Nav and View Issue
!ResolveIssue.png!

Affects both Studio 2.4 and 2.5 (these were added in JIRA 4.2)
fields.summary: JIRA notifications and dialogs appear underneath the Studio header in IE7

fields.description: This has caused lots of troubles in JIRA upgrade because JIRA's CSS rules using JIRA's header id cannot be applied to Studio. And it requires copying the rules over to navbar.css
fields.summary: Use JIRA's header id 'header' instead 'studio-header' as the id for header

fields.description:
Administration->General->Group Browser->Edit Nested Group Members

JIRA 4.3 has added new UI to configure nested groups, as is permitted by Crowd.

If you attempt to add a nested group, e.g. adding the group "balsamiq-mockups-editors" to the group "users", it tries to add "balsamiq-mockups-editors" to "balsamiq-mockups-editors" and dies with a com.atlassian.crowd.exception.ApplicationPermissionException.

It works fine in JIRA 4.3 standalone. In 4.3, even if you explicitly try to add the same group to itself, it doesn't show a 500 page, but shows a user-friendly error at the top of the page: "Cannot add a group to itself."

fields.description:
Administration->Issues->System->Plugins

Using UPM, which is now bundled with JIRA 4.3, an admin is given the ability to disable system plugins, and accidentally break his/her own instance. Is this something we want to expose?

In Studio 2.4 and earlier, we did not even show the list of plugins to admins.

2.4:
!PluginsStudio2.4.png!

2.5:
!PluginsStudio2.5.png!
fields.summary: JIRA 4.3 UPM allows admins to disable System plugins in Studio

fields.description:
Administration->Issues->System->Atlassian Support Tools->Log Scanner->Enter the location of a log file (on your application server).

This option doesn't seem to make sense for Studio - admins aren't going to be privy to server-side file paths.
I recommend we hide this option from customers.

I've set security restrictions on this issue just in case, as (depending on what else is on the server) customers might be able to access files that they're not meant to.

!SupportLog.png!
fields.summary: JIRA 4.3 Support Tools Plugin log scanner asks for server-side file paths

fields.description:
Administration->Issues->System->Atlassian Support Tools->Support Zip.

This feature allows JIRA admins to create a ZIP file of various configuration files. The resulting file is saved on the server where they cannot access it.

I don't see much value in this feature for a Studio admin, I recommend that we hide it.

!SupportZip.png!
fields.summary: JIRA 4.3 Support Tools Plugin creates zip files where the customers cannot access them

fields.description:
Administration->Issues->Other Applications

This screen is new in JIRA 4.3 and allows JIRA admins to configure JIRA as a Crowd Server. We probably don't want to expose this to customers in Studio.

Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

fields.description:
If an EC2 elastic agent is associated with an Elastic IP, either through the AWS console or a start-up script, Bamboo loses connection to the agent.

This is probably because Bamboo insist on communicating with the agent using the instance's original public DNS name/IP, rather than the new one assigned by Elastic IP/DNS name.

Elastic (static) IP support would be extremely useful for example if the build process requires connection to a remote server which is behind a firewall.  The remote firewall can be configured to allow a single IP through rather than completely exposed.
fields.summary: Support for Bamboo Elastic Agents that uses Elastic IP

fields.description:
Things this must do:

* Check filesystem to ensure uploads will fit before accepting the upload
* Check content length when upload starts to ensure the upload will fit
* Stream upload direct to disk (don't keep in memory!)
* Limit upload size to 1GB for attachments, and 100mb for export (or some other sane numbers)
* Once file is uploaded, detect the type of file of the upload (gzip, zip, bzip2, plain text, tar.gz, tar.bz2), calculate size of decompressed content, and fail if decompressing would fill disk
* Decompress content
* Clean up appropriately if anything fails
